page.title: 08HOUSING
page.content: The distribution of settlement is closely related to the shape of the ground. The two villages Stuntney and Little Thetford are found on the higher ground away from the low-lying Fen. Stuntney in particular is a very good example of a dry-site (fen island) settlement, having been built on a small piece of land above the general level of the marshy/flooded area. There are 5 other individual farms in the area. The population density of the area is therefore very low. Stuntney has 52 houses of which about half have been built recently, whilst Lt.Thetford has 84 houses (50 recent), these newer properties are situated more on the outskirts of the village away from the old centre and are evidence of the greater mobility of people today, as the majority do not work near where they live.
